text: Jadgali is an Indo-Aryan language spoken in the Balochistan region of Pakistan and Iran, also spoken in Oman. It is spoken by the Jadgal people. It is considered as dialect of Sindhi language and is closely related to Lasi dialect of Sindhi. ==References== Category:Languages of Iran Category:Languages of Balochistan (Pakistan) Category:Indo-Aryan languages
title: Jadgali language
